ratings.rComments: He was very boring during class but you should definitely go. You won't do well if you just go to discussion and read. Most of the test are based from lecture. Nice guy though and he will help if you go to his office hours. I got sick with pneumonia and he was very helpful over email and let me take the test anytime I wanted.
He gets off topic a lot during lectures. Tests are based off of readings.
Krassa is a boring lecturer, but go anyways. The exams are based off of lecture.

Dear lord, this guy is not a good professor. I passed this class because I knew the constitution and did well in my AP US history class in high school. Krassa also promises podcasts and never posts them, so watch out and don't rely on that. I fell asleep in every lecture, he's that boring. But the TAs saved my ass in this class.

Stay away from any class this guy teaches. His lectures are the most boring I've ever experienced. He writes everything down on paper, barely comes prepared to lecture, talks extremely slow, and always goes off topic. The exam questions are always worded strangely. Even so, the TA's are extremely helpful. They basically teach this class themselves.

class is so dry and boring; the way he lectures contributes to less than 30% attendance every time. barely any prep given for tests and the questions are always worded in the stupidest ways. the TA's are the only saving grace for the class. you can get an A or B if you actually read the whole book and study for years. not what i expected at all.

His lectures are dull and not organized without powerpoints nor outlins. He just writes whatever he wants on a piece of paper. Too much reading materials for a 1evel class. The exams are hard and graded by TAs. He does not talk about anything related to the textbooks. He is very old and should retire.
If you go to lecture, read your textbook and go to discussion, you will do fine in the class. Tests are not too bad, but your grade primarily comes from three tests.

Possibly the worst professor I've experienced so far. The guy obviously doesn't come prepared for lecture. He just stands and rambles for an hour, mostly about things that aren't even related to the course. The guy's a bad joke. Thank God for the TA's. They could each individually do a better job than him.

The TAs are the saving grace of this class. Krassa's style of lecturing is standing up on stage and sort of stream of conscious-ing whatever he feels is relevant. Completely unprepared for lecture. Get Audrey as a TA. Tests have curveball material on them. Don't take this class unless you have to.

No. Just don't take this class and don't look at the workbook!! Worst decision I've made in college! Who has typos in a college level textbook!? And Early lecture in the SOYBEAN RESEARCH CENTER?! Just trust me...Run away. Your GPA and your sanity will thank me.

Krassa is a joke. Don't go to class and read the textbook. He holds class in the Soybean building a million miles away and ditches class without notice. Test are hard, but the TA's are awesome. Audrey is AMAZING. He study guides cover 80% whats on the test, but as long as you read the textbook your fine.

Professor Krassa is incredibly approachable, assigns books that are both interesting AND affordable, and leads class in a seminar format.  It was one of my favorite political science classes on this campus.   The topics are interesting and relate to daily life, and the paper assignment is open ended.

Krassa is a joke of a professor. I don't understand why he is still a professor. We NEVER discuss the course information, we NEVER stay on topic, and everyone in the class hates his teaching style. How can you learn if you have the most boring, least inspiring and uninteresting professor in the PS department? EPIC waste of time.
STAY AWAY FROM CLASS WITH THIS PROFESSOR. HE IS NOT CLEAR. YOU WILL NEVER KNOW WHAT IS ON THE TEST. VERY BORING. GOES OFF ON TANGENTS. GRADE MADE UP OF 3 TESTS AND DISCUSSION SECTION GRADE.

I didn't think it was too hard. I read the book thoroughly and underlined lots of key things along the way so that when it came to the exams, I had less to study. Exams really aren't that hard. AP US in high school was harder. Take good notes and do not just write what he writes down. 9/10 times what he says is what is on the test not what he write
Probably the most boring class.

This class seemed hard for an introductory course and he did not lecture clearly. Very unorganized and reading the book seldom helped on the exams. You basically have to write down everything he says during lecture to do well on his nearly impossible tests. Overall, he is pretty fair though.

Easy content but he makes it confusing. You don't find out until two tests in that his tests are 60% topics covered in lecture, which is incredibly boring. His textbook is terrible and you can't sell it back.

Terrible professor. Exams are definately a curveball every time. Avoid this guy! He can't stay on topic AT ALL. And one of the things he goes off topic and talks about for 2 min will be on the exam and count for a good chunk of your grade. No curves on exams or anything. He talks kind of funny. that is all

He is a terrible professor! DO NOT take his class if you can avoid it. The tests were not fair, and we never could be sure what would be tested. Something that was briefly mentioned one day in lecture may make up most of the exam. Last year this class was easier according to my roommates, but all of the TA's were different this semester.

Exams are extremely unfair.  You never know what will be covered, and something that was talked about for 10-15 minutes in lecture could turn into 20-45% of your exam grade.  NEVER do the optional readings.  They never appear on the exam.

Exams did not cover what was taught in lectures. TAs did a very poor job of explaining as well. Definately a class to weed out the Freshmen from this department. If you're looking for an easy gen-ed and easy A DO NOT take this course, at least not with this professor.

Lecture is pretty boring and on random topics, which occasionally appear on the test. I went to lecture a few times and to most discussions and got A's on tests. The TAs were good about telling us what to study. If you read the book, you should do fine on tests and discussion quizzes. There were no essays, just short answers on tests.

Tests weren't so bad if you used the book; lectures are pretty useful compared to the study guide.  Podcasts helped alot, but attendence fell to under 25% and they were removed.  If you do decide to take a Political Science 101 course, take it with another teacher if you can.
Not a fair professor.  Tests did not cover the material.  Boring lectures.  Would not take another one of his classes

Prof. Krassa's a nice guy. This class is not hard at all. Over 60% of ur grade is quizzes and class participation. easy If you go to lecture most of the quiz questions are directly from one of his lectures n he's a fairly easy grader. Hes always willing to help students and overall this class is great. the 20 page paper at the end is bad but its ok

The exams didn't really cover the material in the lectures too well, but this class isn't very hard -- I missed about 65% of lectures (hey, 8:30 AM lectures are a bad idea) and got an A. The material is easy enough, but use that study guide as your personal Bible -- he loves those multiple choice questions.

This class is not that bad, the tests are not that hard either.  The majority of the multiple choice questions come from the study guide and the essay/short answers come from lecture notes.  If there's anything wrong with this class it's the TA's, not the prof, they do not know a whole lot, and are not helpful or available, whereas prof krassa was.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!Nothing he talked about it class was on the test and the ta's tell you not to study subjects that are worth 1/2 the test grade!Always says that he will talk about something later but never does and then it appears on test!Do not take this class if you care about ur gpa!Supposed to be a 101 class but like 400!Screws kids over!

Ok, this guy honestly needs to stop screwing kids over because test questions are usually never covered in discussion or lecture. His lectures are the most boring thing in the world and he lacks a personality big time. Be prepared to study a lot and then get test questions that have nothing to do with what you study. The TA's are horrible too... th

Do not take this class at 8:30 in the morning...his monotonous tone will put you to sleep in 5 minutes. He means well, but his lectures have nothing to do with the book (or tests for that matter). Lots of questions on the test are strictly from lecture, he doesn't take attendance but it's best to go. DO NOT TAKE THE SECTION WITH JEFF. HORRIBLEEEE

one of the worst professors i ever has. Comppletly unporfessionaly, disorganized, unclear and all over the place. Talks on and on about nothing relating to the course, barely any notes, tests completly do not reflect anything he blabs on about it class and its the worst and most boring class ever. he makes you want to change youir major. DO NOT TAK

This class was harder than I expected. Attendance is not mandatory at lectures, but make sure you go to discussion.  Pop quizzes are straight from multiple choice questions in the study guide, but make sure you study the lecture notes before exams

This class is PS 101 but for some reason his liberal ass thinks it is some 400 level class.  He is extremely boring and I thought about killing myself during his classes.  He expects 101 students to understand all political science terminology even though no one has taken a course in it before!!  He also grades like a stickler...DO NOT TAKE

This is a pretty hard class but really, really interesting. Made me want to change my major. He does a lot of group work and you won't pass if you don't do the work, but the work is pretty interesting. My class had no exams, just a bunch of papers and projects. I hear it now has exams due to complaints from lazy students, so you now have to keep up

This was the easiest class ever. I swear I NEVER took notes, was always half asleep or absent from class, never talked in class and only read 40 pages of one of the books he assigned and I got an A.   He didn't really lecture either; usually people just talked about whatever they wanted, regardless of how irrelevant it was.  It was so depressing.
Quite possible the single best course at the University of Illinois, bar none. Great class. Great teacher. Very helpful and accessible. Learned so much I still can't believe it.

Class is amazing. Clear lectures and high levels of class participation. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO WORK. It has field work, papers and lectures and all are important. I learned a lot and would take more classes from him if I could. I hear he is going into private sector work to make real money.  Take it while you can!

He is SO awkward and his voice is painfully monotonous. It was also annoying because it seemed like the people who liked him the most were really arrogant suburbanites.  I don't think I learned anything from his course; he just talked on and on about very tangential nonsense.
Best class ever. Grounded in founders theories he shows how modern politicians still sometimes follow them-- and not. Easy exams but hard essay assignments.
DO NOT TAKE THE SECTION WITH ANN!!! She is awful and very awkward!

Prof. Krassa is a great professor to have for an introduction PoliSci course. I had no trouble in the class, but only about 6 people in the whole lecture got A's on the midterm (he and the TAs later curved the exam). Not difficult material as long as you read, and Krassa goes over a lot in the lectures. A very approachable teacher; always smiling a

class was 150 when i took it now 101. i thought class was very easy, but a few of my friends had more problems with it. professor lectured on material not relevant to course description, not sure if that has changed since i took the class. got an A in class and took minimal notes and did not do readigns.

Krassa is a pretty decent teacher, but DO NOT TAKE SECTION WITH ANN KOBZA.  You will regret it for the rest of your life, and everyone will think you are dumb because you'll have something other than an A in PS101 on your transcript.

By far my fav prof at U of I; I also had him for elections.  He can be a lil disorganized at times but his assingments are good, class is usually interesting, and he is beyond brilliant but also down to earth at the same time.

if you take this class, take it with Krassa as the professor. Some lectures are pointless, but its easy enough that you dont have to go to every lecture. Dont miss discussion or the simulations, though. Good intro class.

This was possibly the best class I have taken at the University of Illinois.  The class is the only one in Political Science that makes you think about real world issues and policies, and he relates the class to things we actually experience day.  GREAT!!
This course was the best.  His lectures were clear and he involved students with lots of simulations and other exercises.

This class was supposed to be easy.  Prof Krassa's class was hard.  Learned a lot and the Prof was clear. But I had to go to class, which I didn't expect.  And he really makes you think, and you have to participate.

Best professor ever had at UI.  He is fun and clear.  He makes us work hard, but makes it enjoyable.  He has us find ways to apply ideas to things that are of interest to us instead of just to him. He has great connections with politicians and others.

This is a statistics and econometrics class. I had four classes in statistics before this, but I never really understood it until I too his class.  It was very clear, and he taught us the mathematical derivations and also taught about the conceptual logic

Excellent teacher.  Lectures are very clear.  Has frequent exercises that involve students and give us a way to see why things happened instead of just hearing that they did happen.  Lots of guest lectures to connect the theory from books to the real worl

He is very understanding when it comes to personal issues that may be effecting your work and he is easy to talk to. In addition, students tend to pay attention because often he brings in guest speakers.
